main event: An object described as an oblate, white light turning greenish blue was observed over Charleston, South Carolina for approximately 6 to 8 seconds in 1953.
interesting points: The object left a visible trail of 20 to 30 feet long,The object was identified as a reliable observer due to straight and level flight,The conclusion drawn was that it was probably an astronomical event, specifically a meteor,The object was observed from the airport tower and from a rain location nearby,The sighting occurred at night and was seen 13 degrees above the horizon.
sighted object: one oblate white light turning greenish blue with a trail
witness description: One military observer and one civilian tower operator
